ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This course covers a mix of negotiation and meeting facilitation.

I thought that the instructor did a very good job with this course. Class time was used efficiently, materials in and out of class were valuable and informative, and the out of class exercises and assignments were useful and enlightening.

I believe the strengths of this class rely on having better case studies and letting students get more involved in an actual environmental negotiation or conflict. Although the professor's effort was good, there was a bit of disconnection with students.
In general, the course was very valuable, but the pace felt a bit slow at times.
More negotiations exercises outside of class to be reported on and discussed during class would be good additions.
This Course is valuable, but mabe he name confounds people. It is a course to help you become a coach on conflict resolution, but I was expecting a course focused on negotiation.

Course was able to provide only a very rudimentary and introductory appreciation of negotiation and conflict resolution. There was no specific emphasis on environmental issues and negotiations related to them.
Group exercises, in-class discussions.
Ona is great. She is very passionate about the subject she teaches.
Great professor! interesting material that is important not just professionally but personally - widely applicable.
The in and out of class exercises. All were very useful.
The out of class assignments were really useful for solidifying concepts from class and learning more about our own negotiation ability and style.
Knowing some opportunities on how to facilitate meetings.
the small group assignments
The negotiations exercises and the practical skills for negotiating and facilitating meetings offered during the final class meeting.
The practical [introductory]process design skills bestowed upon us. The opportunities for group discussion and full class participation. Group exercises and simulations were engaging and educational.
The negotiation assignments.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: There is too much important material to cover within a 1-credit course format.
The breakout exercise on Kroon sustainability was weak. Would have been good for us to know we were going to do this in advance, so that we could think beforehand some helpful recommendations.
perhaps too many assignments for a 1 unit course.

The only complaint I have is that the supplemental materials (especially the readings and case studies) available to students should have been explained just so we knew what was available to use to help with the assignments or potentially of use to us in the future or if we were curious.
More time devoted to practical exercises and techniques would be beneficial.
Pace of the course--a bit rushed.
Attractive study cases
more engagement during class time
More content related to negotiation rather than facilitation.
This course would be worth developing into a three credit semester long course.

1. More practical sessions2. More emphasis on negotiation and conflict resolution in the context on environmental issues3. More role playing4. Address advanced needs of students who already have some exposure to negotiation and conflict resolution
The course should start at the beginning of the semester rather than during midterms season.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: great availability
Both were very good. No complaints, no suggestions for improvement. The instructor teaches the class professionally and was accessible and valued all comments from students.
Both were very responsive and provided detailed feedback.
N/A
The instructor and TA made themselves available, but I did not have the need to seek help.
Excellent. Both the instructor and the TA were responsive, helpful, and enthusiastic about the course.
they were always available to help and their comments were always helpful.
Adequate

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: The facilitation skills should come in handy in our professional life, almost regardless of what we set out to do.

This was a subject area that I was looking forward to learning more about, since I had been using these skills and had been placed in similar scenarios professionally for the last several years. I anticipate that these skills are essential in my life, both professional and personal, going forward.
This course should help students make good decision when being facilitators and when taking decisions under pressure while working with stakeholders.
What I learned about meeting and negotiation facilitation will be extremely valuable for my career in which I expect to frequently be working with a wide range of stakeholders.
I am sure that I will use the skills aquired in the course. Im focuing on Energy and the environmental and Im sure that my job will involve solving conflicts.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I am interested in learning more about facilitation and negotiations and how they fit into environmental problem-solving so this course was a great primer. I feel prepped to take more advanced classes in negotiations and will generally be a better planner/facilitator/presenter after taking the course.
I wanted to learn more about conflict resolution and negotiation and how I could correct bad habits, improve these skills, and continue to build on them in thefuture.

Because in the place I was working before coming to F&ES there was a lot of loss time while organizing meetings and when facilitating meetings with farmers. Also, I believed this course would help me take better decisions on how to proceed in certain situations.
i'm interested in the topic, but also because I needed an extra credit.
To learn about theories of and practical skills for negotiation.
I am interested in cooperative planning and environmental conflict negotiation.
I wanted a negotiation class because I had a job hat required his skill and I had to learn it on my own.
To to be able to engage in and manage better the conflicting requirements of many stakeholders in resolving environmental issues.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
It was neither a WOW course nor a waste of time.
Yes
Yes, it was very good.The only suggestion I would make is to focus on more negotiating tactics, especially when money is on the line.
yes
No. I felt a little bit disappointed. Much more interaction with other students and more real-life international negotiations where expected from my part.
Not quite given the emphasis on facilitation rather than negotiation, but it was valuable nonetheless.
yes.
The conflict resolution part did, but I was expecting a little bit more on the negotiation part.
No

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: yes
Yes, I believe so.
yes
See question 17.
yes.
no

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: There were no disadvantages to the group work, overall it was very well run and the group work was rewarding and worthwhile.

Group work was an attempt to apply concepts/skills learned in class. However the group exercises felt a little "fake". May be better to seek situationsoutside of the classroom (real life) to apply skills/concepts.
Got to know my classmates much better - the activities were tons of fun
Learning valuable insight from other individuals with varied backgrounds.No disadvantages, in this case. All of the exercises were best suited for group work.
Working in a group always helps to develop team work and tolerance. Also, this helps to help understand and listen to people.
Group work was essential to practicing negotiation skills and meeting facilitation. Critical to the course.
this was the best part -- i really learned from my classmates

The group assignments (negotiation exercise and development of negotiation process) were both useful aspects of the class. I would only suggest that more group work be assigned and that it be focused on negotiation exercises.

The simulations were great exercises. I did miss out on a group simulation due to my own oversight, and because the groups were self organized and there was no formal sign-up, there was no feedback loop to help me catch my mistake.
It was nice to see the solutions brought by other people.
The group work was the best part

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This course is about multi-party negotiation -- it is not about two-party business negotiation. Be sure you read the syllabus and description of the class clearly so you know what to expect.
Ask lots of questions in class - you will get out what you put in - engage in the exercises.
Consider other similar courses given in other schools, for example, the one at SOM.
Know that the focus of the course as it was taught this semester was weighted much more heavily toward facilitation than negotiation.
You're allowed to miss one out of the five class sessions, but you should not miss out on any of them.
Take this course to improve your conflict resolution skills. Spend some time doing the readings before class.
Take it only if you have absolutely no clue of what negotiations and conflict resolution is. Do not expect this course to advance any existing skills or knowledge
